name: places/ChIJ1UyWxAtZwokRqmRf8pgeqTs
formattedAddress: 160 Christopher St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 160 Christopher St, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text:
A nice and elegant place. Decor is true Sabyasachi themed masterclass. They carry good selection of outfits and items but can’t really compare with what you will get in their shop in India. They do have limited selection of outfits based on the current style and season, home decor items are not available. With what they have, customer service is nice and staff is courteous.
With a lot of tourist visiting the place, it gets busier sometimes and staff can have difficulty to know who’s genuinely there for shopping. You don’t need to reserve time ahead of time for fitting, walk-ins are welcomed.

originalText.text:
The handbags at Sabyasachi NYC, while undeniably elegant, do come at a premium when compared to established online retailers. This establishment primarily caters to the bridal market, where the emphasis lies in the overall experience rather than just the accessory. The store itself is a masterpiece of ornate beauty and warrants a visit.

However, it is worth noting that the handbags could benefit from improved craftsmanship, aligning with the brand's reputation. In addition, the absence of clear authentication and provenance markers leaves room for improvement. Nevertheless, for those seeking a holistic, opulent bridal shopping experience, Sabyasachi NYC remains an enticing destination.

originalText.text:
**APPARENTLY you don't need appointments for fittings, just FYI**

My recent visit to the Sabyasachi store in New York was a sensory journey through exquisite artwork and opulent fashion pieces. The store's ambiance exuded a sense of luxury and sophistication, creating an immersive experience that complemented the brand's reputation for unparalleled craftsmanship.

The artwork displayed throughout the store was truly captivating, seamlessly blending with the rich tapestry of Sabyasachi's fashion creations. The attention to detail in both the décor and the clothing showcased the brand's commitment to aesthetics and storytelling, creating a unique and memorable shopping environment.

However, my experience with the staff left me with mixed feelings. While the overall service was competent, I found some members of the staff to be less than helpful. I don't quite recall the first person's name - they were friendly, however they were NOT helpful. I mentioned twice that I wanted to try on something and they said they'd get back to me.... (Spoiler: they never did). Asked again later on, another staff member said in 5-10 minutes. 30 minutes later, a friend asked when would we be getting to try my outfits and they "found time" for us. We were quite annoyed seeing people who walked in get to try on clothes (around 1 PM btw, we've been there since 11 AM...)  I was appointed Sophia to assist with my fitting.

Fortunately, Sophia was a shining exception. Her attentiveness, product knowledge, and genuine willingness to assist made my shopping experience significantly more enjoyable. Sophia's exceptional customer service skills elevated the overall impression of the store.

Despite the unhelpful encounters with some staff members, the allure of Sabyasachi's breathtaking artwork and luxurious fashion pieces remains undeniable. The brand's commitment to artistic expression and attention to detail is evident in every corner of the store. For those seeking an indulgent shopping experience, Sabyasachi NY is undeniably a destination worth exploring - just be sure to cross paths with someone like Sophia, who adds a touch of warmth and expertise to the opulent journey.

originalText.text: A wonderful adventure history lesson filled with traditions, customs, jewels, and abundance of beautiful, handcrafted items. Take time to read the walls. You will find more than pearls of wisdom. Clothes and accessories too.

text.text: A wonderful adventure history lesson filled with traditions, customs, jewels, and abundance of beautiful, handcrafted items. Take time to read the walls. You will find more than pearls of wisdom. Clothes and accessories too.

originalText.text:
Just went to this place, unbelievably well decorated, almost felt like a museum in a lot of ways.
Great experience wandering the halls and just looking everything up and down.
It almost feels a little like an afterthought to state that the collection, no matter if you are in the market for a bag, and outfit or jewellery is spectacular, my wife was hard pressed to decide between a couple of pieces.

We were able to walk away with a piece we feel is stunning and timeless, though it says a lot that that can be said about quite a few different pieces in the building .
